info.title: OttoFMS Developer API
info.description: ## Authentication The OttoFMS Developer API uses exactly the same authentication as the **Claris FileMaker Server Admin API**. The OttoFMS API can also use OttoFMS Admin API keys to authenticate the OttoFMS API and proxy to the FileMaker Admin API. See the **OttoFMS Docs** for more information.

get.summary: Verify that this server can reach another server
get.description:
### Check the network.
Otto servers communicate over http. There must be valid network path between them for them to communicate. This endpoint can be used to verify that the network path is valid, that is, that this server can talk to the other server.

parameters.name: otherServerUrl
parameters.description: The url of the other server

parameters.name: isLegacy
parameters.description: is the other server running Otto 3

get.description: Get information about the OttoFMS server and FileMaker Server.

parameters.name: remote_name
parameters.description: remote location name. this value will be slugified

get.description: Get FileMaker server preferences for this server

post.description:
### Run a script via schedule  
Run a script using the FileMaker Scheduled Script Scripting Engine.
It is an alterantive to running a script via the Data API, oData API,
or Custom Web Publishing. Unlike those, this method doesn't require an
an account with an extended privelege set, other than the one required
to run on a Server.  

The Schedule will be created, run and then deleted.

get.summary: Download a file from FileMaker Server
get.description: Calling this endpoint will make a copy or clone of a file and start streaming the file back to the client. This intended to be used by browser based clients as it will automatically create download the file using the browser default download location.
Calling this endpoint will make a copy or clone of a file and send back a link which can be used to download a zip of the file. See the next endpoint for how to download the file.

get.summary: Get a file with a download link
get.description: Use a get request to download a file from a link obtained from a previous endpoint. This is useful if you want to download the file into a FileMaker Container field for example.
List all builds in the server outbox

### Download a build zip using a download url
The download url is a signed url that can be used to download a build zip. This endpoint will return a 404 if the build does not exist.

The url can be obtained from the `Get Build Status` endpoint.

### Download a zip containing the build folder using a download url
The download url is a signed url that can be used to download a build zip. This endpoint will return a 404 if the build does not exist.

The url can be obtained from the `Get Build Status` endpoint.

### Stream a build zip
Stream a build zip from the server. This endpoint will return a 404 if the build does not exist.

post.description: Publish a build to another server or an offsite location

get.description: Returns the sub-deployment data for the given sub-deployment Id

post.description: Use this endpoint to start a deployment. The deployment will be started asynchronously and you can use the `/deployment` endpoint to check the status of the sub-deployments.
Restores the backup created before the given deployment Id to the state before the deployment was started.
Restores the backup created before the given deployment Id to the state before the deployment was started.
Rebuilds the original deployment input and reruns the deployment with the same options. Can be used to rerun a full deployment or a specific sub-deployment
Use this endpoint to abort the running deployment.

### Start, stop and restart various FileMaker Server processes.

**Caution:** Restarting or Stopping a process will kill anything that might be running on that process. Use with caution.

The `service` property can be one of the following:
- `wpe`
- `fmse`
- `adminserver`
- `httpserver`
- `fmsib`
- `xdbc`
- `server`
- `fmdapi`
- `odata`

The `command` property can be one of the following:
- `start`
- `stop`
- `restart`

### Create an OttoFMS Admin Api Key

This endpoint creates an Admin API Key for the FileMaker Server with the specified user and password.

patch.summary: Update an Admin API Key label

post.description:
### Create an OttoFMS Data API Key

This endpoint creates a Data API Key for the FileMaker file with the specified user and password.
Write a new log line to the app log.

files.description: Array of FileMaker files to include in the build

stopBuildOnFail.description: if true and the script doesn't complete successfully, then the build will fail.

preBuildScript.description: script to be run before files are backed up

closeFiles.description: Close files before backing up. This setting is ignored for clones. If the file is encrypted, it will be closed and reopened with the encryption key.

ensureFilesOpen.description: If true, OttoFMS will ensure that the files are open at the end of the build. This is useful if the files were closed when the build started but you want to ensure they are open when the build is complete.

compressionLevel.description: The compression level used by OttoFMS to compress the build zip. Higher values of this will make the zip smaller but will use more resources. Lower values will keep the .zip file big but will use less resources.

memoryLevel.description: The amount of memory used by OttoFMS to zip the build. Higher values will let the process use more memory to zip and will make the process faster. Lower values will use less memory and will make the process slower.

sendOnFailure.description: If set to true, the subsequent action will be sent even if the previous action fails

url.description: URL to send subsequent action to

zipArchive.description: the name of the zip file

zipSize.description: the size of the zip file in bytes

completedFiles.description: The number of files finished and in the zip

tags.name: FileMaker Files
tags.description: Actions that can be performed on a FileMaker files

tags.name: Deployment
tags.description: Deployments are the process of *deploying* files to a FileMaker Server. Each deployment can have multiple files. Each file can be either a new file or an existing file. If the file already exists on the server, it can be replaced or the data can be migrated into the new file using the Data Migration Tool.

tags.name: Data API Keys
tags.description: Data API Keys are used as a proxy for the FileMaker Data API.

tags.name: Admin API Keys
tags.description: Admin API Keys are used as a proxy to the FileMaker Server Admin API

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks are used to send data from external services to your FileMaker solutions.
